title: I found the girl in the photo - now our abuser is in jail
description: Emma tracked down the girl whose picture was in the home of a music teacher who abused her as a teenager.

title: Putin's mysterious Facebook 'superfans' on a mission
description: Posts praising the Russian leader are being viewed by millions on the social network.

title: 'I'm under no illusions,' says British soldier in Ukraine, after comrades killed
description: Ajay Spence quit his life in Belfast to help defend Kyiv - now he is being redeployed to east Ukraine.

title: Cost of living crisis: Nurse skips meals to feed her children
description: A single mother working for the NHS says rising prices mean she is struggling to pay for food.

title: The microchip implants that let you pay with your hand
description: You can now get a payment chip injected beneath your skin, turning you into a human bank card.

title: Cost of living: 'My money-saving life hacks'
description: With a squeeze on household budgets, how are Londoners saving money?

title: Somalia drought: 'Act now or 350,000 children will die'
description: In what experts call Somalia's worst drought in a decade, children are facing severe malnutrition.

title: Falklands War: 'The UK is still usurping our land'
description: Argentina's president has said he will keep fighting for control of the islands, also known as the Malvinas.

title: Manchester City 2-2 Liverpool: 'A joy to watch' - action and reaction from Alan Shearer
description: Match of the Day 2's Alan Shearer analyses the key incidents from Manchester City v Liverpool, a game he describes as "a joy to watch".

title: Ukraine village scarred by aftermath of occupation
description: As Russian forces retreat to eastern Ukraine, Andriivka and other abandoned villages are left devastated.

title: France election: This time it won’t be a walkover for Macron
description: Emmanuel Macron will face a run-off against Marine Le Pen, in what is far from a done deal.

title: Akshata Murty: Inquiry into leak of Rishi Sunak's wife's taxes begins
description: Labour says a row over Akshata Murty's tax affairs raises questions over the chancellor's judgement.

title: Ronaldo: Police investigating after Manchester United forward appears to break fan's phone
description: Merseyside Police are investigating an alleged assault after Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo appeared to break a fan's phone.

title: Imran Khan ousted as Pakistan's PM after vote
description: The former cricket star loses a no-confidence vote 13 hours after his party tried to delay it.

title: French election: Macron faces far-right challenge as France votes
description: The opening round of the French presidential race could become a cliffhanger for Emmanuel Macron.

title: ‘A fantasy’ - amateur jockey’s Grand National fairytale
description: Grand National-winning jockey Sam Waley-Cohen pays tribute to his brother after 'fantasy' triumph in his last-ever ride.

title: Why is steroid use rising among male bodybuilders?
description: More bodybuilders are taking drugs knowing the damage they can do to their bodies, an academic says.

title: Hauliers want priority for perishable goods at Dover
description: Drivers say deliveries of produce like meat are losing quality and value in long waits at the port.

title: Ukraine war: Johnson and Zelensky tour near-empty streets in Kyiv
description: Boris Johnson makes a surprise visit to Ukraine's capital, and meets President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Australian Grand Prix: Charles Leclerc wins in Melbourne as title rival Max Verstappen retires
description: Charles Leclerc takes a dominant victory in the Australian Grand Prix to move into a commanding position in the World Championship.

title: Dwarfism: Woman's battle against ignorance starts in schools
description: Danielle endures frequent name-calling, stares and people trying to take photos of her.

title: Full embargo on oil could stop war - ex-Putin aide
description: President Putin's former chief economic advisor tells the BBC Western countries could stop the war.

title: Henry Patterson: The Eagle has Landed author dies aged 92
description: Henry Patterson wrote 85 novels, including the WW2 thriller penned under the pseudonym Jack Higgins.

title: Masters: Scottie Scheffler leads at Augusta, Cameron Smith & Shane Lowry chasing
description: American Scottie Scheffler remains in a good position to win his first major at the Masters, but sees his lead reduced late in Saturday's third round.

title: Masters: Tee-times for Scottie Scheffler, Tiger Woods & Rory McIlroy at Augusta National
description: Tee-times for round four of the Masters at Augusta National with Scottie Scheffler leading from Cameron Smith.

title: Masters: Scottie Scheffler and Cameron Smith shine in Masters day three best shots
description: Leaderboard heavyweights Scottie Scheffler, Cameron Smith and Charl Schwartzel all feature in the best shots of day three at the 2022 Masters at Augusta.
